column12: Proper Form

column4: Linear and lateral swings to open hip capsule.
column12: Keep torso vertical; use a wall for balance; avoid arching the lower back.

column4: Pull knee to chest on toes.
column12: Pull knee high; stay tall on the "post" leg; engage the glute of the standing leg.

column4: Rotate knee/hip to pull shin to chest.
column12: Pull at the ankle and knee simultaneously; keep chest up; feel the stretch in the outer hip.
Back leg straight; rotate chest toward the front knee; follow hand with eyes.
Keep back flat; flex toes toward shin (dorsiflexion); do not round shoulders forward.

column4: Hinge, walk hands to plank, walk feet in.
column9: Feet walk to within 12" of hands.
column12: Keep legs as straight as possible; engage core in plank; walk feet up using small ankle hops.
Keep weight in the heel of the bent leg; chest up; trail foot stays flat on the floor.
Minimal knee bend; "flick" the ground with the balls of the feet; stay vertical.
Thigh parallel to ground; toe pulled up (dorsiflexed); opposite arm/leg coordination.
Cycle leg forward then aggressively pull the foot back under the center of mass.
Keep the "post" leg straight; cycle the working leg in a tight, circular "step-over" motion.
Start smooth; increase turnover rhythmically; maintain relaxed shoulders and face.

column4: Small, fast steps over the ankle.
column12: Fast foot contacts; stay on the balls of the feet; ankles stay tight and "springy."
Punch the foot down directly under the hip; maintain a tall, "stiff" spine.

column10: Knee above hurdle at all times.
column12: Step "over the pipe"; keep hips high and level; avoid leaning back.
Maintain vertical torso; landing should be light and directly under the body.
Drive the lead knee up powerfully; punch the opposite arm toward the sky.
Push off the ground at a 45-degree angle; maximize "hang time" in each skip.
Straight line from head to heel; drive knee to chest; maintain a rigid core.
Focus on "pushing the ground away"; aggressive arm drive; lean into the hill.
Do not bend at the waist; keep the body stiff like a board until the first step.

column4: One hand on ground, drive out.
column12: Weight distributed between feet and hand; look slightly down; explode forward, not up.
Maintain a low shin angle; drive through the balls of the feet; keep arms locked or slightly bent.
Strike the ground with the midfoot; pull the ground backward; keep knees locked.

column4: Hurdles spaced further for top speed.
column12: Focus on "stepping over" the opposite knee; stay tall; do not reach for the gaps.

column4: Max speed over wickets after build-up.
column12: High hips; "quiet" upper body; focus on fast, vertical ground strikes.
Maintain relaxation at peak speed; avoid "clenching" the jaw or shoulders.
In the "float," maintain speed without pushing; in "max," increase arm frequency.
Maintain upright sprinting mechanics; focus on a high knee lift as fatigue sets in.
Aggressive piston-like leg drives; keep the back flat and core braced.
Smooth transitions between zones; focus on "bouncing" off the track during the float.
Lean the entire body into the curve; keep the inside shoulder slightly lower.
Efficient arm swing (hip to chin); stay on the balls of the feet throughout.
Focus on deep breathing and "fluid" movement; prioritize form over speed.
Bar close to shins; explosive hip snap; catch bar with elbows high and pointed forward.

column4: Floor to overhead in one motion.
column12: Wide grip; one continuous movement; catch with locked arms and active shoulders.
Feet shoulder-width; knees track over toes; keep weight centered over the midfoot.
Elbows high to keep the bar shelf stable; sit "down" between the knees.
Fall forward as slowly as possible; keep hips extended (don't "pike" at the waist).

column4: Squat on one leg for stability.
column12: Control the descent; don't let the knee collapse inward; keep hips level.
Upright torso for quads, slight lean for glutes; front knee stays behind toes.
Reach arms forward for counter-balance; back foot should not touch the floor.

column4: Hinge at hips to target hamstrings.
column12: Push hips back until a stretch is felt; keep the bar against your legs; flat back.
Chin tucked; shins vertical at the top; squeeze glutes hard at full extension.
Land in a partial squat; step down (don't jump down) to protect the Achilles.
Triple extension (ankles, knees, hips); throw the ball up and back as far as possible.

column4: Heavy walk to build core strength.
column12: "Tall" posture; ribcage down; small, controlled steps; don't let weights swing.
Full range of motion; pause at the top/bottom of the movement.

column4: Lift knees to chest from bar.
column12: Avoid swinging; compress the abs to pull the pelvis toward the ribs.
Create a straight line from ears to heels; squeeze glutes and quads.
